item.title: 尽管通胀飙升，英国央行可能仍将降息
item.description: 英国央行很可能在周四再次降息，因为增税和消费者的谨慎态度阻碍了英国经济的发展，并促使企业放缓招聘步伐。【原文：The Bank of England is likely to deliver another interest-rate cut on Thursday, as tax hikes and wary consumers hamper Britain’s economy and prompt firms to slow hiring.】

item.title: 乌克兰反腐机构在无人机采购调查中拘留四人
item.description: 乌克兰反腐机构称，在对无人机和干扰系统采购中 "大规模 "腐败的调查中，有四人被拘留。【原文：Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies said four people had been detained in a probe into “large-scale” corruption in the procurement of drones and jamming systems.】

item.title: 欧佩克+原则上同意再次大幅增加供应
item.description: 据一位代表称，欧佩克+成员国已原则上同意在 9 月份再次大幅提高石油产量，该集团正努力夺回其在全球原油市场上的份额。【原文：OPEC+ members have agreed in principle on another bumper oil production increase for September, according to a delegate, as the group moves to reclaim its share of global crude markets.】

item.title: 对美国公司而言，欧洲难以抗拒：信贷周刊
item.description: 越来越多的公司开始向欧洲寻求廉价融资，这一转变在短期内对美国企业债务构成利好。【原文：Companies are increasingly looking to Europe to raise money cheaply, a shift that is turning out to be a near-term positive for US corporate debt.】

item.title: 伊朗称接近解决与伊拉克的天然气出口问题
item.description: 伊朗石油部长穆赫辛-帕克内贾德（Mohsen Paknejad）周六表示，伊朗和伊拉克即将解决有关伊朗天然气供应中断和巴格达未支付出口欠款的争端。【原文：Iran and Iraq are close to resolving a dispute over disruptions to Iranian gas supplies and Baghdad’s unpaid dues for the exports, Iran’s Oil Minister Mohsen Paknejad said Saturday.】

item.title: 特朗普的下一份工作向持怀疑态度的美国人推销他的经济政策
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在其复出任期的六个月里，已经完全掌握了美国经济的主导权。无论好坏，他的政党现在都必须将其推销给选民。【原文：Six months into his comeback term, Donald Trump has taken full ownership of the US economy. For better or worse, his party must now sell it to voters.】

item.title: 加拿大权衡报复成本，分析师警告反击不值得
item.description: 加拿大今年早些时候决定对美国的关税进行报复，这似乎正在促使唐纳德-特朗普总统与美国邻国打交道的方式出现分歧。【原文：Canada’s decision to retaliate against US tariffs earlier this year appears to be driving a divergence in how President Donald Trump is dealing with America’s neighbors.】

item.title: 大型科技公司盈利强劲是阴暗股市中的一盏明灯
item.description: 华尔街对本周的大型科技公司财报能否达到越来越高的预期寄予厚望。总的来说，这些公司都实现了预期。【原文：Wall Street had a lot riding on whether this week’s big-tech earnings would meet increasingly high expectations. By and large, the companies delivered.】

item.title: 新濠以新的轻资产模式拓展全球赌场业务
item.description: 新濠环亚娱乐有限公司首席执行官何猷龙表示，该公司正在洽谈将其品牌扩展到澳门以外的地区，计划通过与当地合作伙伴合作共同经营数十亿美元的赌场项目，加强轻资产战略。【原文：Melco Resorts & Entertainment Ltd. is in talks to expand its brand beyond Macau, with plans to ramp up an asset-light strategy by teaming up with local partners to co-run multi-billion-dollar casino projects, Chief Executive Officer Lawrence Ho said.】

item.title: 美国合作伙伴为何在贸易问题上屈服于特朗普
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普担任总统的第一个任期内，日本是个例外，他选择不对特朗普提高关税的做法进行报复，因为已故首相安倍晋三认为，为了维护更广泛的经济和安全关系，最好还是放弃这些做法。【原文：In Donald Trump’s first term as president, Japan stood out as an exception in opting not to retaliate against his tariff hikes, as the late Prime Minister Shinzo Abe reckoned it was better to shrug them off in favor of maintaining the broader economic and security relationship.】

item.description: 在今年上半年经济增长放缓之后，美国劳动力市场摇摆不定；贸易政策带来的不确定性增加，也对劳动力市场产生了影响。【原文：The US labor market is wavering after a slowdown in economic growth during the first half of the year — implications of heightened uncertainty tied to trade policy.】

item.title: 在 "极端 "波动导致损失后，Andurand 从可可的错误行为中撤出
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一封发给投资者的信，著名石油交易商皮埃尔-安杜兰（Pierre Andurand）在一系列错误的交易导致巨额亏损后，已经从对可可的看涨押注中撤出。【原文：Famed oil trader Pierre Andurand has pulled back from a bullish bet on cocoa after a series of mistimed trades led to deep losses, according to a letter sent to investors that was seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 新西兰将在热门旅游景点向外国游客收费
item.description: 新西兰将开始向外国游客收取高达 40 新西兰元（24 美元）的费用，以游览米尔福德步道（Milford Track）和库克山（Mount Cook）等最受欢迎的旅游胜地。【原文：New Zealand will begin charging foreign tourists up to NZ$40 ($24) to visit its most popular tourist destinations such as Milford Track and Mount Cook as the government seeks ways to help spur economic growth.】

item.title: 澳大利亚寻求将混合工作权利写入法律
item.description: 澳大利亚维多利亚州打算全面修订工作场所法律，以规定混合工作权利，这令商业团体感到恼火，他们预计此举将破坏人们的信心。【原文：Australia’s Victoria state intends to overhaul workplace laws to enshrine hybrid working rights, irking business groups who anticipate the move will undermine confidence.】

item.title: 英格兰银行降息给家庭带来 110 亿英镑的损失
item.description: 英格兰银行开始降息整整一年了，一代人以来最高的借贷成本给家庭带来的压力仍在增加。【原文：Exactly one year since the Bank of England started to cut interest rates, the pressure on households from the highest borrowing costs in a generation is still building.】

item.title: 香港监管机构接受中国移动的香港宽带收购承诺
item.description: 香港竞争监察机构已接受中国移动香港公司就收购宽带服务提供商香港宽带有限公司（HKBN Ltd.）的建议所做的承诺，不会进行调查，从而为该合并案的进行扫清了障碍。【原文：Hong Kong’s competition watchdog has accepted commitments by China Mobile Hong Kong regarding its proposed acquisition of broadband provider HKBN Ltd. and won’t pursue an investigation, clearing the way for the merger to proceed.】

item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周五得到了一些糟糕的经济消息，他的回应是向信使开枪。【原文：President Donald Trump got some bad economic news Friday, and responded by shooting the messenger.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织将阿根廷 2025 年的储备目标放宽 50 亿美元
item.description: 国际货币基金组织在阿根廷本月未能达到一项关键基准后给予了阿根廷喘息的空间，使该国更容易继续执行其 200 亿美元的融资计划。【原文：The International Monetary Fund gave Argentina breathing room on a key benchmark after it missed the target this month, making it easier for the country to continue with its $20 billion funding program.】

item.title: 特朗普势头推动稳定币成为亚洲金融中心的迫切需求
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对与美元挂钩的加密货币的拥护，亚洲市场正在匆忙更新其稳定币规则，这给该地区当局带来了新的紧迫感。【原文：Asian markets are hurriedly updating their stablecoin rules as President Donald Trump’s embrace of US dollar-pegged cryptocurrencies instills a fresh sense of urgency among the region’s authorities.】

item.title: 墨西哥沃尔玛首席执行官伊格纳西奥-卡里德突然辞职
item.description: 美国零售商沃尔玛墨西哥公司（Wal-Mart de Mexico SAB）称，公司首席执行官伊格纳西奥-卡里德（Ignacio Caride）递交了辞呈，将从今天开始离开公司最高职位。【原文：Wal-Mart de Mexico SAB, the local unit of the US retailer, said Chief Executive Officer Ignacio Caride presented his resignation and is leaving the company’s top job, effective today.】

item.title: 萨克斯看到大块新贷款已以折扣价提供
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，陷入困境的零售商萨克斯全球企业（Saks Global Enterprises）一个多月前获得的一笔新贷款的一部分，在关键的债务置换截止日期到来之前，正在二级市场上以低于面值的价格出售。【原文：Portions of a new loan that struggling retailer Saks Global Enterprises obtained a little more than a month ago were being offered in the secondary market at below-par prices ahead of a key debt swap deadline, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 万斯和劳工部吹捧特朗普现在痛恨的就业数据
item.description: 副总统万斯和劳工部长洛里-查韦斯-德雷默（Lori Chavez-DeRemer）在他们的上司唐纳德-特朗普总统解雇负责监督数据的人员前几小时，试图对疲软的就业数据进行积极的解读，他们在没有证据的情况下声称，这份令人沮丧的报告是出于政治动机。【原文：Vice President JD Vance and Labor Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer sought to put a positive spin on weak jobs numbers hours before their boss, President Donald Trump, fired the person who oversees the data, claiming without evidence that the dour report was politically motivated.】

item.title: 苹果公司首席执行官在长达一小时的动员讲话中告诉员工人工智能是 "属于我们的"。
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc.首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）在财报发布后召开了一次罕见的全体员工会议，围绕公司的人工智能前景和 "令人惊叹 "的产品线，对员工进行了动员。【原文：Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook, holding a rare all-hands meeting following earnings results, rallied employees around the company’s artificial intelligence prospects and an “amazing” pipeline of products.】

item.title: Blackstone 出售自 2008 年金融危机以来最大的英国 CMBS
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 出售了超过 15 亿英镑（20 亿美元）的债券，这些债券由 Haven 运营的英国度假公园提供支持，这是自 2008 年金融危机以来最大的英镑计价商业抵押证券。【原文：Blackstone Inc. sold more than £1.5 billion ($2 billion) in bonds backed by UK holiday parks operated by Haven, the largest ever pound-denominated commercial mortgage security since the 2008 financial crisis, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】
